page.title: 01Stroma
page.content: Stroma is an island in the Pentland firth. 3 kilometers north west of John O'Groats in Caithness. The island is 3 kilometers long and 1 1/2-2 kilometers wide. It was inhabited until the 1960's when its economy declined and it was abandoned. There are several crofts and a school all of which are now derelict. The only inhabitants on Stroma now are three lighthouse keepers in the lighthouse at the north of the island at Swilkie Point. Access to Stroma is difficult becaue there is no longer any boat service. This area of the survey includes the north of Stroma there is a singl rod running north-south along the island with several derelict crofts nearby At the northern tip is the Stroma Lighthouse which marks the passage through the Pentland Firth.
